channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [PDFBOX-2513] false negative? RuntimeException: EOL encountered in white run
item.description:
java.lang.RuntimeException: EOL encountered in white run.
at org.apache.pdfbox.filter.ccitt.TIFFFaxDecoder.decodeWhiteCodeWord(TIFFFaxDecoder.java:1168)
at org.apache.pdfbox.filter.ccitt.TIFFFaxDecoder.decodeT6(TIFFFaxDecoder.java:980)
at org.apache.pdfbox.filter.CCITTFaxFilter.decode(CCITTFaxFilter.java:95)
at org.apache.pdfbox.cos.COSStream.doDecode(COSStream.java:386)
at org.apache.pdfbox.cos.COSStream.doDecode(COSStream.java:335)
at org.apache.pdfbox.cos.COSStream.getDecodeResult(COSStream.java:290)
at org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.graphics.image.PDImageXObject.<init>(PDImageXObject.java:115)
at org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.graphics.PDXObject.createXObject(PDXObject.java:65)
at org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.process.reflect.ResourcesValidationProcess.validateXObjects(ResourcesValidationProcess.java:285)
at org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.process.reflect.ResourcesValidationProcess.validate(ResourcesValidationProcess.java:80)
at org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.utils.ContextHelper.callValidation(ContextHelper.java:81)
at org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.utils.ContextHelper.validateElement(ContextHelper.java:54)
at org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.process.reflect.SinglePageValidationProcess.validateResources(SinglePageValidationProcess.java:167)
at org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.process.reflect.SinglePageValidationProcess.validate(SinglePageValidationProcess.java:82)
at org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.utils.ContextHelper.callValidation(ContextHelper.java:81)
at org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.utils.ContextHelper.validateElement(ContextHelper.java:54)
at org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.process.PageTreeValidationProcess.validatePage(PageTreeValidationProcess.java:56)
at org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.process.PageTreeValidationProcess.validate(PageTreeValidationProcess.java:45)
at org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.utils.ContextHelper.callValidation(ContextHelper.java:81)
at org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.utils.ContextHelper.validateElement(ContextHelper.java:118)
at org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.PreflightDocument.validate(PreflightDocument.java:168)
item.summary: false negative? RuntimeException: EOL encountered in white run

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
2513.pdf is not liked by Linux Acrobat Viewer 9 either, so maybe this is a false positive of pdftron?

but I am wondering whether throwing a RuntimeExecption during a validation is really intended?
The file validates in Acrobat Pro 10 and newer on Windows as well as PDF Tools PDF Validator.

Also in other places in that area RuntimeExceptions are thrown - e.g.

java.lang.RuntimeException: Invalid code encountered while decoding 2D group 4 compressed data.
at org.apache.pdfbox.filter.ccitt.TIFFFaxDecoder.decodeT6(TIFFFaxDecoder.java:1083)
at org.apache.pdfbox.filter.CCITTFaxFilter.decode(CCITTFaxFilter.java:95)

or

java.lang.RuntimeException: Invalid code encountered while decoding 2D group 4 compressed data.
at org.apache.pdfbox.filter.ccitt.TIFFFaxDecoder.decodeT6(TIFFFaxDecoder.java:1017)
We need to throw IOException instead of RuntimeException, there are many cases of this in TIFFFaxDecoder and all of them need changing.
I agree that throwing RuntimeException is a no-no. But I'd prefer to put a try/catch around that weird SUN legacy code to produce an IOException, in CCITTFaxFilter.java.
I'm not sure I follow: why would we want to do that?

With "around" I meant around the call to it in CCITTFaxFilter. To avoid changing the sun legacy code that nobody really understands well and of which we could some day get a better version. Some day we'll have to do something similar for other filters that also rely on mysterious code from sun / oracle. So I'd rather but the code higher, i.e. in COSStream.doDecode(). Something like this:

try
{
  ...
  filter.decode(...);
  ...
}
catch( IOException io )
{
   length--;
   exception = io;
}
catch (RuntimeException re)
{
   length--;
   exception = new IOException(re);
}

What you're proposing is to catch a runtime exception and throw a checked exception from it. That's a serious problem, as you'll end up turning runtime exceptions such as OutOfMemoryException into IOException. One should never catch RuntimeException, ever*.

While the CCITT code is certainly complex, the exceptions are straightforward, they should be IOExceptions, there should be no doubt about that.

*Ok, maybe for logging? If it's re-thrown. Actually that doesn't seem like a great idea either.
a first step with patch2513.txt - the good news: after the change, no additional errors surfaced.

Commit 1641878 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1641878 ]

PDFBOX-2513: replace RuntimeException with IOException, as suggested by Ralf Hauser and John Hewson
Thanks, I applied your patch as you submitted it.

a first step with patch2513.txt

Anything else you'd like us to do?
as msahu confirmed 6 days ago, it is a false negative - so the real issue is still open

As per PDFBOX-1018 maybe lehmi would post the issue "upstream" at http://xmlgraphics.apache.org/ since the real know-how appears lie there - see
http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/xmlgraphics/commons/trunk/src/java/org/apache/xmlgraphics/image/codec/tiff/TIFFFaxDecoder.java?view=markup ?
Yes, we should post this issue upstream, unfortunately the real know-how might not be there either as this code was donated to Apache by Sun a number of years ago - the code dates from 2005.

The (incorrect) image is being decoded as a result of ResourceValidationProcess calling PDXObject.createXObject. This constructs a PDImageXObject, which decodes the image stream. The decoding is needed because for some types of images, some of the image information is taken from the image itself.

The problem is in page 3, it is /Img329 (475 0 obj) that doesn't decode.

This mentions a possible fix:
http://itext-general.2136553.n4.nabble.com/Fix-for-quot-EOL-code-word-encountered-in-White-run-quot-in-TIFFFaxDecoder-td2145534.html

The updated source code is here:
https://java.net/nonav/projects/jai-core/sources/svn/content/tags/root-1_1_3/src/share/classes/com/sun/media/jai/codecimpl/TIFFFaxDecoder.java?rev=111

I haven't tested it. I don't really see this as a high priority unless it can be proven that this is indeed a bug, i.e. that the image is correct.
tilman, so you are saying that Acrobat Pro 10 and newer on Windows as well as PDF Tools PDF Validator have a false positive on this?

BTW, COSStream.doDecode() drops several IOExceptions and only shows the last one.

For even better error messages also see PDFBOX-2529

While looking at this, I notice that this error generates a ValidationException that is never converted into a ValidationError - don't we possibly loose other errors that could be reported with benefit?

patch2513a.txt does not immediately abort validation, but does it like all other validations, record the error and tries to continue.

This gives some additional errors albeit some of them may be caused by the first one:
1: 2 : Unknown error, EOL encountered in white run. - on page 0
java.io.IOException: EOL encountered in white run.
at org.apache.pdfbox.filter.ccitt.TIFFFaxDecoder.decodeWhiteCodeWord(TIFFFaxDecoder.java:1170)

2 : Unknown error, Stream was not read - on page 1
java.io.IOException: Stream was not read

3: 2 : Unknown error, Stream was not read - on page 2
java.io.IOException: Stream was not read

5: 2 : Unknown error, Stream was not read - on page 3
java.io.IOException: Stream was not read
at org.apache.pdfbox.cos.COSStream.getDecodeResult(COSStream.java:295)

6: 2 : Unknown error, Stream was not read - on page 4
java.io.IOException: Stream was not read
at org.apache.pdfbox.cos.COSStream.getDecodeResult(COSStream.java:295)
at org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.graphics.image.PDImageXObject.<init>(PDImageXObject.java:115)
at org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.graphics.PDXObject.createXObject(PDXObject.java:65)
at org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.process.reflect.ResourcesValidationProcess.validateXObjects(ResourcesValidationProcess.java:285)
at org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.process.reflect.ResourcesValidationProcess.validate(ResourcesValidationProcess.java:80)

at org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.process.PageTreeValidationProcess.validate(PageTreeValidationProcess.java:47)

at org.apache.pdfbox.preflight.PreflightDocument.validate(PreflightDocument.java:168)

Something must be wrong, this error should appear on page 3 only (counting from 1). I'll research this.

I'm not persuaded that your patch is the right thing to do, because it breaks a separation intended by the original devepment team.

The XObject resource /Img329 appears in every page, although it isn't used in every page. This is because every page references the resource object 3. This is a weakness in preflight that resources objects are sometimes checked several times, I've already mentioned this elsewhere, this will be fixed some day.

which "separation by the original development team" do you mean?

PDFBOX-2531 helps understanding the problems of this issue here (provided the "separation" is given up)

I mean that the original team (3 people from Atos worldline, which then donated preflight to Apache) had a good reason to throw ValidationException for problems that are not really PDFA-non-compliance problems.

PDFBOX-2531 is about a follow-up problem, i.e. that the stream is null because it wasn't read. But it wasn't read because there's some problem with the decompression from CCITT G4 decoding. THAT is the real problem, and we haven't even found out whether the cause is a bug in the filter, or a bug in the file.

Is the "good reason" of the contributors documented anywhere?

If I want to get a PDFA-compliance report and one of the imported graphics has a (n unconfirmed!) problem, does that automatically mean that I am no longer interested in any further PDFA-non-compliance findings?

All we have is the source code. Which has this ValidationException and derived classes, for cases where it doesn't make much sense to go on. There has been a thought about this in PDFBOX-1632 by one of the original developers, and the current exception was kept.

But all this discussion is useless because the real problem ("EOL encountered in white run") won't go away just because an error is attached instead of an exception being thrown. Instead you'd get an error that won't be shown by other products.

I have a few ideas about this encoding but it isn't on my top priority list now. I will have more time soon, especially around the end of december.

IMHO there are two issues here

  • the validation stops because of a potential error in the stream
  • the question if there is an error in the stream or not

For the validation shouldn’t we turn the ValidationException into a ValidationError inline with PDFBOX-1632 which will allow further processing? I agree that the real cause won’t go away with that change, so there is still the question if there is an error in the stream or not. But it will help in cases where there are additional errors after such stream.

hauser@acm.org wo having a definitive decision about the fact if the stream is wrong and how to deal with that we will have a (false ?) negative regardless of the fact if we throw an exception or report that as an (false ?) error.

1) Adobe Reader 11 produces an error too.
2) I remember that I had written a little tool to create TIFF files from raw CCITT G4 compressed data. With that, I used JAI as it is distributed to read that file, and got an error.

Then I looked at the hex view of object 475. It is very different to other image objects with 1 row. There are lots of 00 and 20 which is unusual for a compressed stream.

In the tests for PDFBOX-457, I had the problem of "6 extra bytes". Here, there are 0x1c4 extra bytes at the beginning. After skipping these, I am able to read the file with JAI.

3) There is another problem of not throwing an exception. If we swallow the exception, then the command line utility wouldn't show details on what happened. We would have to expand the command line utility to show the exception, or write another utility that does so (like Ralf has probably done) to display the exception. Or maybe include the stack trace in the XML.

tilman you are right that Adobe Reader as well as Acrobat display a dialog box about a potential issue with the file when scrolling to page 3. At the same time the file validates as a valid PDF/A-1b file with Acrobat and there are no syntax errors reported with Acrobats Preflight tool. I’ll get in touch with some more people about their thoughts.

As for 3) Generally speaking if possible Preflight shouldn’t stop processing a file if possible collecting all errors moving forward. You’re much more into the details of Preflight than I am but wouldn’t we be able to report the issue on the command line if we collect the problem as part of a ValidationError?
page 3 as displayed in Adobe Reader and Mac Preview

msahyoun Yes that is what Ralf asked for. Yes of course it is possible e.g. with the patch he provided. I'll sleep over it and then probably do it. I realize that there are other occurrences where we catch parse errors (e.g. my commit in XMP from yesterday) and add it to the error list.

I attached screenshots of page 3 using Adobe Reader and Mac Preview for rendering. Mac Preview can render the file wo any issues and as can be seen the upper part of the image on page 3 is missing in the rendering using Adobe Reader. IMHO Adobe Preflight shouldn’t validate that file.

I did a retest of the validation using Adobe Acrobat XI which provides a different picture to my former test with Acrobat X. The file is shown to be invalid because of the image on page 3.

Thanks to Olaf Drümmer for pointing that out.
AcrobatXI Preflight dialog

Commit 1642643 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1642643 ]

PDFBOX-2513: replace exception with error, as suggested by Maruan Sahyoun and Ralf Hauser

Commit 1642644 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1642644 ]

PDFBOX-2513: add fallback text to graphics errors
Can this be set to resolved now?

patch2513b.txt improves error message 4 since it is the least specific one, so if we now the page-number I guess we should also disclose it (if we have an undefined error number "-1", at least say where it happened ).

The result is then:
2 : Unknown graphics error, EOL encountered in white run. for Image entry 'Img329'
2 : Unknown graphics error, Stream was not read - filter: CCITTFaxDecode for Image entry 'Img329'
2 : Unknown graphics error, Stream was not read - filter: CCITTFaxDecode for Image entry 'Img329'
-1 : Unknown error, Unable to check the ContentStream : Stream was not read - filter: CCITTFaxDecode - on page 2
2 : Unknown graphics error, Stream was not read - filter: CCITTFaxDecode for Image entry 'Img329'
2 : Unknown graphics error, Stream was not read - filter: CCITTFaxDecode for Image entry 'Img329'

In the same vein, we should also mention the page number in
.ResourcesValidationProcess.validateXObjects() .

I’d suggest that we close the issue as

  • it has been shown that there is an issue within the file so it’s not a false negative
  • the handling has been improved so preflight continues processing the file

Further optimizations such as improved error messages can be handled in a new issue.

patch2513b1.txt replaces patch2513b.txt because I noticed that the exception handling in SinglePageValidationProcess.java was substandard (it ignored the root cause).

Similarly I liked tilman's idea of mentioning the subtype, but it should be done where it is reported in all cases it happens,
I agree with Maruan - could you please delete the last comments and patches and attach these to PDFBOX-1675 or PDFBOX-2529?

so, after consulting with further sources, it appears to be a false negative

~ "PDF/A-1 (and to a lesser degree also PDF/A-2 and PDF/A-3) do not require that embedded formats, that are defined by referenced standards (image formats, fonts ….), also have to be completely validated against those referenced standards"
no, that’s not the case. As the decoding fails the validation shall fail too.

ok, so while "1: 2 : Unknown error, EOL encountered in white run. - on page 0" is not really an error but could be a warning since it is TIFF specific (see PDFBOX-2562)
"Stream was not read - filter: CCITTFaxDecode for Image entry 'Img329' on page 1" prevents other mandatory validation checks from being fully executed (make this better transparent as per PDFBOX-2562 )

Thanks to msahyoun for pointing this out.
to not block 2.00 release

reopen to set to resolved instead. ralfhauser we set issues to resolved when we made changes, we close them with the release. We only close immediately for duplicates, "not a problem", etc, i.e. when we do nothing in the code.
we got permission to reuse the file 2513.pdf under ASF 2.0 license from Claudia Schreiber.
